titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 with respect to the treatment of certain amounts paid under life insurance contracts on account of illness or disability.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 7/26/1988--Introduced. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to treat as tax-excludible compensation for injuries or sickness any amounts received as health care benefits under a life insurance contract that are used in connection with: (1) a physical or mental condition requiring hospitalization for 150 days or longer; or (2) long-term or terminal physical or mental impairment of the taxpayer.
